references.paper_title: Diagnosing model performance under distribution shift
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the work presented as it provides an aggregate decomposition of the performance gap into covariate shift and outcome shift.

references.paper_title: Double/debiased machine learning for treatment and structural parameters
references.reason: This paper introduces the method of one-step correction from semiparametric inference, which is used to derive debiased ML estimators.

references.paper_title: Data Shapley: Equitable valuation of data for machine learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Shapley attribution, which is used for attributing importance of each variable to the decomposition of the performance gap.

references.paper_title: Efficient nonparametric statistical inference on population feature importance using Shapley values
references.reason: This paper introduces a computationally efficient procedure for estimation and inference of Shapley values.

references.paper_title: “Why did the model fail?”: Attributing model performance changes to distribution shifts
references.reason: This paper introduces a nonparametric hierarchical framework for explaining why the performance of an ML algorithm differs across domains, which is similar to the method presented here.
